title: Touching Computers: Creating Data Talismans
subtext: a workshop weaving digital and physical worlds
descriptionMd:
**Workshop History**
- (forthcoming) at [Gray Area](http://grayarea.org/)
- 05/04/24 **ancient futures** at Stanford University
- 04/24/24 at [madsci](https://www.madsci.io/)

I made "[SIGIL I](https://spencer.place/creation/SIGIL-I/)" to be my first *webstone*, a ceramic charm that holds my website. I carry my website around in my pocket and "give" my website to people I meet by tapping their phones with the talisman. These data talismans don't just have to hold your website. They can be infused with any digital media, from a message to a nostalgic image to a favorite song. These "touching computers" can be molded (much like clay) according to their creator's expressions and serve as intimate portals into their identity.
In this workshop, we’ll interweave the physical and digital worlds and create a clay sculpture to hold websites, carry digital media, and send messages using natural air-dry clay. After, we'll explore how these "touching computers" can create a foundation for communal exchange and facilitate solidarity within a community. Attendees will leave with their own functional data talisman.
Contact me if you’d like to [invite me](https://spencer.place/collab#invite) to host it with you.
